comment.body:
Hi @renovate[bot]. Thanks for your PR.

I'm waiting for a [metal3-io](https://github.com/orgs/metal3-io/people) member to verify that this patch is reasonable to test. If it is, they should reply with `/ok-to-test` on its own line. Until that is done, I will not automatically test new commits in this PR, but the usual testing commands by org members will still work. Regular contributors should [join the org](https://github.com/orgs/metal3-io/people) to skip this step.

Once the patch is verified, the new status will be reflected by the `ok-to-test` label.

I understand the commands that are listed [here](https://go.k8s.io/bot-commands?repo=metal3-io%2Fmetal3-dev-env).

<details>

Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available [here](https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md).  If you have questions or suggestions related to my behavior, please file an issue against the [kubernetes/test-infra](https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/issues/new?title=Prow%20issue:) repository.
</details>

Fixes #

issue.title: Bump markdownlint to v0.12.0 and pin sha digest

labels.name: size/S
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 10-29 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: approved
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by an approver from all required OWNERS files.

labels.name: lgtm
labels.description: Indicates that a PR is ready to be merged.

issue.body:
Use markdownlint image 0.12.0 pinned by SHA instead of latest.

In markdownlint 0.12.0 unordered lists are required to have 3 space prefix, while 0.11.1 needed only 2. This is due Kramdown dependency. This behavior changed and broke the markdown validations, preventing contributions, thanks to "latest" tag.

All of the Metal3 repositories (except one, PR pending) markdown files and their hack/markdownlint.sh validators have been fixed, and prow need to be up to date as well.

In addition, dependencies should be pinned by SHA, to guard against unintended changes via tag update. This also makes OpenSSF Scorecards happier.

issue.title: use mdl 0.12.0

labels.name: do-not-merge/work-in-progress
labels.description: Indicates that a PR should not merge because it is a work in progress.

issue.body:
Use markdownlint image 0.12.0 pinned by SHA instead of latest.

In markdownlint 0.12.0 unordered lists are required to have 3 space prefix, while 0.11.1 needed only 2. This is due Kramdown dependency. This behavior changed and broke the markdown validations, preventing contributions, thanks to "latest" tag.

All of the Metal3 repositories (except one, PR pending) markdown files and their hack/markdownlint.sh validators have been fixed, and prow need to be up to date as well.

In addition, dependencies should be pinned by SHA, to guard against unintended changes via tag update. This also makes OpenSSF Scorecards happier.

pull_request.title: 🌱 Bump golang to v1.19 and other go module dependencies and fix golint test
pull_request.body: Regarding the golint, I noticed that https://quay.io/repository/metal3-io/golint was successfully build over a year ago and failed to build on any changes on that file afterwards. The [dockerfile](https://github.com/metal3-io/baremetal-operator/blob/main/hack/Dockerfile.golint) of golint used in this repo uses a deprecated way of installing golangci-lint, and it is not needed anymore since we anyhow use and build golangci-lint form go modules in [lint](https://github.com/metal3-io/baremetal-operator/blob/main/Makefile#L89-94) phony in `Makefile`.  Hence using a plain golang container is good enough for golint test.

The [dockerfile](https://github.com/metal3-io/baremetal-operator/blob/main/hack/Dockerfile.golint) of golint used in this repo uses a deprecated way of installing golangci-lint, and it is not needed anymore since we anyhow use and build golangci-lint form go modules in [lint](https://github.com/metal3-io/baremetal-operator/blob/main/Makefile#L89-94) phony in `Makefile`.  Hence using a plain golang container is good enough for golint test.

issue.title: Bump markdownlint to v0.12.0 and pin sha digest

labels.name: size/S
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 10-29 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: approved
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by an approver from all required OWNERS files.

labels.name: lgtm
labels.description: Indicates that a PR is ready to be merged.

issue.body:
Use markdownlint image 0.12.0 pinned by SHA instead of latest.

In markdownlint 0.12.0 unordered lists are required to have 3 space prefix, while 0.11.1 needed only 2. This is due Kramdown dependency. This behavior changed and broke the markdown validations, preventing contributions, thanks to "latest" tag.

All of the Metal3 repositories (except one, PR pending) markdown files and their hack/markdownlint.sh validators have been fixed, and prow need to be up to date as well.

In addition, dependencies should be pinned by SHA, to guard against unintended changes via tag update. This also makes OpenSSF Scorecards happier.

comment.body:

>
>All of the Metal3 repositories (except one, PR pending) markdown files and their hack/markdownlint.sh validators have been fixed, and prow need to be up to date as well.

prow: use mdl 0.12.0

In markdownlint 0.12.0 unordered lists are required to have 3 space
prefix, while 0.11.1 needed only 2. This is due Kramdown dependency.

All of the Metal3 repositories (except one, PR pending) markdown files
and their hack/markdownlint.sh validators have been fixed, and prow
need to be up to date as well.

In addition, dependencies should be pinned by SHA, to guard against
unintended changes via tag update. This also makes OpenSSF Scorecards
happier.

Merge pull request #453 from Nordix/tuomo/markdownlint-image-update

Bump markdownlint to v0.12.0 and pin sha digest

pull_request.title: Bump markdownlint to v0.12.0 and pin sha digest
pull_request.body:
Use markdownlint image 0.12.0 pinned by SHA instead of latest.

In markdownlint 0.12.0 unordered lists are required to have 3 space prefix, while 0.11.1 needed only 2. This is due Kramdown dependency. This behavior changed and broke the markdown validations, preventing contributions, thanks to "latest" tag.

All of the Metal3 repositories (except one, PR pending) markdown files and their hack/markdownlint.sh validators have been fixed, and prow need to be up to date as well.

In addition, dependencies should be pinned by SHA, to guard against unintended changes via tag update. This also makes OpenSSF Scorecards happier.

issue.title: use mdl 0.12.0

labels.name: do-not-merge/work-in-progress
labels.description: Indicates that a PR should not merge because it is a work in progress.

issue.body:
Use markdownlint image 0.12.0 pinned by SHA instead of latest.

In markdownlint 0.12.0 unordered lists are required to have 3 space prefix, while 0.11.1 needed only 2. This is due Kramdown dependency. This behavior changed and broke the markdown validations, preventing contributions, thanks to "latest" tag.

All of the Metal3 repositories (except one, PR pending) markdown files and their hack/markdownlint.sh validators have been fixed, and prow need to be up to date as well.

In addition, dependencies should be pinned by SHA, to guard against unintended changes via tag update. This also makes OpenSSF Scorecards happier.

pull_request.title: 🌱 Bump golang to v1.19 and other go module dependencies and fix golint test
pull_request.body: Regarding the golint, I noticed that https://quay.io/repository/metal3-io/golint was successfully build over a year ago and failed to build on any changes on that file afterwards. The [dockerfile](https://github.com/metal3-io/baremetal-operator/blob/main/hack/Dockerfile.golint) of golint used in this repo uses a deprecated way of installing golangci-lint, and it is not needed anymore since we anyhow use and build golangci-lint form go modules in [lint](https://github.com/metal3-io/baremetal-operator/blob/main/Makefile#L89-94) phony in `Makefile`.  Hence using a plain golang container is good enough for golint test.

Regular contributors should [join the org](https://github.com/orgs/metal3-io/people) to skip this step.

Once the patch is verified, the new status will be reflected by the `ok-to-test` label.

hack: use mdl 0.12.0

Pin markdownlint image to 0.12.0 with SHA to guard against changes
without explicit acknowledgement.

Makes OpenSSF scorecard happier as well by pinning down another
dependency.

Merge pull request #803 from Nordix/tuomo/pin-markdownlint-image

Bump mdl to 0.12.0 and pin it to sha:digest

issue.title: Bump markdownlint to v0.12.0 and pin sha digest

labels.name: size/S
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 10-29 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: approved
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by an approver from all required OWNERS files.

labels.name: lgtm
labels.description: Indicates that a PR is ready to be merged.

issue.body:
Use markdownlint image 0.12.0 pinned by SHA instead of latest.

In markdownlint 0.12.0 unordered lists are required to have 3 space prefix, while 0.11.1 needed only 2. This is due Kramdown dependency. This behavior changed and broke the markdown validations, preventing contributions, thanks to "latest" tag.

All of the Metal3 repositories (except one, PR pending) markdown files and their hack/markdownlint.sh validators have been fixed, and prow need to be up to date as well.

In addition, dependencies should be pinned by SHA, to guard against unintended changes via tag update. This also makes OpenSSF Scorecards happier.

issue.title: use mdl 0.12.0

labels.name: do-not-merge/work-in-progress
labels.description: Indicates that a PR should not merge because it is a work in progress.

issue.body:
Use markdownlint image 0.12.0 pinned by SHA instead of latest.

In markdownlint 0.12.0 unordered lists are required to have 3 space prefix, while 0.11.1 needed only 2. This is due Kramdown dependency. This behavior changed and broke the markdown validations, preventing contributions, thanks to "latest" tag.

All of the Metal3 repositories (except one, PR pending) markdown files and their hack/markdownlint.sh validators have been fixed, and prow need to be up to date as well.

In addition, dependencies should be pinned by SHA, to guard against unintended changes via tag update. This also makes OpenSSF Scorecards happier.

pull_request.title: 🌱 Bump golang to v1.19 and other go module dependencies and fix golint test
pull_request.body: Regarding the golint, I noticed that https://quay.io/repository/metal3-io/golint was successfully build over a year ago and failed to build on any changes on that file afterwards. The [dockerfile](https://github.com/metal3-io/baremetal-operator/blob/main/hack/Dockerfile.golint) of golint used in this repo uses a deprecated way of installing golangci-lint, and it is not needed anymore since we anyhow use and build golangci-lint form go modules in [lint](https://github.com/metal3-io/baremetal-operator/blob/main/Makefile#L89-94) phony in `Makefile`.  Hence using a plain golang container is good enough for golint test.

The [dockerfile](https://github.com/metal3-io/baremetal-operator/blob/main/hack/Dockerfile.golint) of golint used in this repo uses a deprecated way of installing golangci-lint, and it is not needed anymore since we anyhow use and build golangci-lint form go modules in [lint](https://github.com/metal3-io/baremetal-operator/blob/main/Makefile#L89-94) phony in `Makefile`.
